bestBHT.bht: Judas' portion in the ministry was obtained by divine appointment, chosen through the casting of lots by the Master. Despite his esteemed role, his heinous betrayal of Jesus serves as a stark reminder to believers about the potential for treachery even among those entrusted with great responsibility. This cautionary tale emphasizes the need for vigilance and discernment within the community of believers, as well as the inherent providential nature of God's plan, utilizing even the darkest events to fulfill His purposes.

Archibald T. Robertson: Periphrastic past perfect passive indicative of καταριθμεω, old verb, but here only in the N.T."
Received his portion (ελαχεν τον κληρον). Second aorist active indicative of λαγχανω, old verb, to obtain by lot as in Luke 1:9; John 19:24, especially by divine appointment as here and 2 Peter 2:1.
So Peter says that Judas 'obtained by lot the lot of this ministry' (διακονιας) which he had when he betrayed Jesus. The Master chose him and gave him his opportunity.

And had obtained part of this ministry; by lot, as the word signifies; the providence of God so ordering it, according to his eternal purpose and decree, that he was not only called an apostle, and enrolled among them, but he really had a part in that ministry...

bhtAttempts.bht: Judas, though he had obtained his portion in the ministry through divine appointment, ultimately fell into destruction by betraying Jesus. The fact that someone so highly esteemed could turn against the very one who chose him for this sacred role is truly astounding. This serves as a warning to the other apostles and believers to be vigilant and careful in their own lives, guarding against any potential treachery or deceit, for even those we may trust can falter. Furthermore, the inclusion of Judas in the group of apostles and his involvement in the ministry highlights the providential plan of God, who orchestrates even the darkest events for His ultimate purpose.

Judas, having received his portion in the ministry by divine appointment, surprised the others with his treacherous betrayal of Jesus. This shocking turn of events serves as a cautionary tale, reminding believers to be vigilant and cautious, not only in the face of external threats, but also in regard to those within their own ranks. The inclusion of Judas among the apostles underscores God's sovereign plan, working even through the darkest actions to accomplish His purposes.
